column4: this happens with a second ubuntu box as well, but the share works in windows and had no issues a week ago
that username and pass is fake, didnt want to put my real one in there!
works fine a my Vista box and XP box, but not on either Ubuntu boxes
have you tried using smbclient to see if it is mount or cifs causing the issue?
check the permissions on the Windows PC
You might want to run Wireshark and monitor the SMB traffic to see what the Windows PC is reporting
No!, *permissions* on the Windows NTFS directory/files, and the share
Also, if Windows is refusing it the reports will be in the Event log
read my lips! The NTFS file-system permissions ON THE WINDOWS PC may have changed - that would cause the error you report
So what does the Windows PC event log report when the Linux PC attempts to connect?
Like I said before, it would be a good idea to use Wireshark to view the SMB traffic on the wire, then you can see precisely what is being said by both ends
That's good then... that means you know it is local to the Linux PC
I found a reference for mount which says:
But, the best thing is to use Wireshark
